i clone the dubbo-samples-zookeeper, using <dubbo.version>2.7.7</dubbo.version> everything is fine,but when i switch it to 2.7.8, it shows "Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Failed to receive INITIALIZED event from zookeeper, pls. check if url zookeeper://ip:2181/org.apache.dubbo.metadata.report.MetadataReport?backup=ip1,ip2&client=&dubbo.config-center.root-path=/&timeout=10000 is correct
" what can i do to fix the problem

> i clone the dubbo-samples-zookeeper, using <dubbo.version>2.7.7</dubbo.version> everything is fine,but when i switch it to 2.7.8, it shows "Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Failed to receive INITIALIZED event from zookeeper, pls. check if url zookeeper://ip:2181/org.apache.dubbo.metadata.report.MetadataReport?backup=ip1,ip2&client=&dubbo.config-center.root-path=/&timeout=10000 is correct
> " what can i do to fix the problem

you can configure like this (modify according to your needs) :
`<dubbo:metadata-report address="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181?init.timeout=60000" timeout="60000"/>`
or disable metadata registration :
`<dubbo:metadata-report />`

We got the same exception which using 2.7.8 version, and can't resolve it by FlyingHe's suggestion.
```
you can configure like this (modify according to your needs) :
<dubbo:metadata-report address="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181?init.timeout=60000" timeout="60000"/>
or disable metadata registration :
<dubbo:metadata-report />
```

> We got the same exception which using 2.7.8 version, and can't resolve it by FlyingHe's suggestion.
> 
> ```
> you can configure like this (modify according to your needs) :
> <dubbo:metadata-report address="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181?init.timeout=60000" timeout="60000"/>
> or disable metadata registration :
> <dubbo:metadata-report />
> ```
I really resolved this problem By this wayï¼Œso
could you please show your configuration hereï¼Ÿ

Sure, here is the configuration:
```
dubbo:
  metadata-report:
    address: zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181?init.timeout=60000
    timeout: 60000
```

And the error log is:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Failed to receive INITIALIZED event from zookeeper, pls. check if url zookeeper://localhost:2181/org.apache.dubbo.metadata.report.MetadataReport?dubbo.config-center.root-path=/&init.timeout=60000&timeout=60000 is correct

pls fix ut failure

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9292748/90889270-6d127500-e3ea-11ea-9c25-ae3157d87f3a.png)
lgtm

> And the error log is:
> java.lang.IllegalStateException: Failed to receive INITIALIZED event from zookeeper, pls. check if url zookeeper://localhost:2181/org.apache.dubbo.metadata.report.MetadataReport?dubbo.config-center.root-path=/&init.timeout=60000&timeout=60000 is correct

Are you sure that your zookeeper is running and it's address is 127.0.0.1:2181 ? if you confirm it is right, maybe you should debug the code for finding out the problem thoroughly .

By the way ,the reason of the problem is that the dubbo need upload some meta data to zookeeper  and it wait for time out ,so 
if you needn't the function you can disable it by configuring empty metadata-report
`<dubbo:metadata-report />`
The zk server address is a fade one, and I'm using the spring boot's yml file to config the metadata-report, do you know how to disable it by the yml file ?
LGTM
LGTM

pls merge to master branch if u want to contribute to 2.7.x version. 
Also, pls fix ut failure.

`replaceWithLazyClient`  will be called when invoker close. This means invoker should not being invoked in the future, which cannot be reconected. Reconnect happends when the situation like network temporarily failure. If you use a registry to discover provider, when provider restart, a new invoker will be created.
LGTM
It seems as if configcenter apis are located in `dubbo-common` module. The package is `org.apache.dubbo.common.config.configcenter`.

Could you pls provide some class names which are marked `Deprecated`? In the master branch, there are still a lot of classes not marked `Deprecated`. Also, the latest version of Apache Dubbo is 2.7.8.
The `scheduledExecutors` will be used by Service Discovery model in the future, and this issue has been fix in #6618 .

Packages located in `com.alibaba.dubbo` are moved to `org.apache.dubbo` since 2.7.x version. You can refer this in https://dubbo.apache.org/zh-cn/docs/user/versions/version-270.html.

> The zk server address is a fade one, and I'm using the spring boot's yml file to config the metadata-report, do you know how to disable it by the yml file ?

Just like this(Set value to nothing) :

```
dubbo:
  metadata-report:
    address: 
```

> ut

ok, I'll close the pr and open a new request to master unit test later. I'll try to find the cause.

I'm also confuse about the dubbo:parameter , it doesn't seem to work,
sometimes we don't want to use RpcContext explicitly, but want to configure extra-param through a configuration file.

> I'm also confuse about the dubbo:parameter , it doesn't seem to work,
> sometimes we don't want to use RpcContext explicitly, but want to configure extra-param through a configuration file.

Like @DIscord010  said `<dubbo:parameter>` is a parameter configuration, which is used by Dubbo to config RPC properties. It is the same like `retries` properties in `<dubbo:reference>`. The only way to pass implicit parameters is using `RpcContext.getContext().setAttachment`.

> > I'm also confuse about the dubbo:parameter , it doesn't seem to work,
> > sometimes we don't want to use RpcContext explicitly, but want to configure extra-param through a configuration file.
> 
> Like @DIscord010 said `<dubbo:parameter>` is a parameter configuration, which is used by Dubbo to config RPC properties. It is the same like `retries` properties in `<dubbo:reference>`. The only way to pass implicit parameters is using `RpcContext.getContext().setAttachment`.

upgrade to jackson2 as following works fine for me. exclude jackson firstly:
`
            <dependency>

                <groupId>org.apache.dubbo</groupId>

                <artifactId>dubbo-rpc-rest</artifactId>

                <version>${dubbo.rpc.version}</version>

                <exclusions>

                    <exclusion>

                        <groupId>org.jboss.resteasy</groupId>

                        <artifactId>resteasy-jackson-provider</artifactId>

                    </exclusion>

                </exclusions>

            </dependency>
`
add jackson2 then:
`
            <dependency>

                <groupId>org.jboss.resteasy</groupId>

                <artifactId>resteasy-jackson2-provider</artifactId>

                <version>${resteasy.version}</version>

            </dependency>
`
